Regime_B2C: Telemarketing to consumers requires prior consent (opt-in):contentReference[oaicite:197]{index=197}.
Regime_B2B: Telemarketing to businesses is also restricted; explicit consent or clear prior indication of interest is required:contentReference[oaicite:198]{index=198}.
AIDisclosure_Required(Y/N/Depends): Not specified (automated calls require prior consent under EU law)
Existing_Relationship_Exemption(plain_te: No general exemption – even existing customers must have consent (no “soft opt-in” for calls):contentReference[oaicite:200]{index=200}
Known_Exceptions(notes): None specific (all unsolicited consumer calls need consent; emails have ECG list opt-out):contentReference[oaicite:201]{index=201}
CallerID/Prefix_Rules: Caller ID must not be concealed (per telecom rules; no special prefix mandated).
Recent_Changes(2024+): No major recent changes noted; current rules from TKG 2021 and ECG remain:contentReference[oaicite:202]{index=202}.
Notes_for_Product: No DNC list for calls (only email list). Platform should obtain express consent before calling any Austrian consumer or business. Treat all cold calls as opt-in only.

Regime_B2C: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed only if the person has not objected or registered on the national Do Not Call list:contentReference[oaicite:205]{index=205}:contentReference[oaicite:206]{index=206}.
Regime_B2B: Telemarketing to businesses is similarly permitted unless the number is on the Do Not Call Me list (covers B2B and B2C):contentReference[oaicite:207]{index=207}.
DNC_Registry_Name: Do Not Call Me List (Liste Ne m’appelez plus)
Existing_Relationship_Exemption(plain_te: No exemption: even existing customers must not be called if they opted out via DNCM:contentReference[oaicite:210]{index=210}.
Known_Exceptions(notes): Calls not covered by “marketing” (e.g. purely survey or political) are not subject to the DNCM law.
CallerID/Prefix_Rules: Caller ID must be visible (anonymous calls are prohibited by Code of Economic Law). No special prefix.
Recent_Changes(2024+): No recent changes. DNCM list in place since 2015:contentReference[oaicite:211]{index=211}.
Primary_Sources(max3;official): DNCM Official Site:contentReference[oaicite:212]{index=212}:contentReference[oaicite:213]{index=213}; Code of Economic Law, Art. XII.13
Notes_for_Product: Platform must integrate DNCM scrubbing for all Belgian numbers (including corporate). Apply consumer quiet hours as best practice.

Regime_B2C: Telemarketing to consumers is prohibited without prior consent:contentReference[oaicite:214]{index=214} (opt-in required).
Regime_B2B: Telemarketing to businesses: presumed consent model (allowed unless objected).
Existing_Relationship_Exemption(plain_te: No. Even existing customers must have consent for calls (no EBR exemption recognized).
Known_Exceptions(notes): Direct marketing via email/fax requires identification and opt-out; live calls require consent:contentReference[oaicite:215]{index=215}. Market research calls (non-sales) may fall outside “direct marketing”.
CallerID/Prefix_Rules: Caller identity must not be concealed (per Electronic Communications Act).
Recent_Changes(2024+): No major changes noted. E-Communications Act provisions still applicable:contentReference[oaicite:216]{index=216}.
Primary_Sources(max3;official): Art. 261 Electronic Communications Act:contentReference[oaicite:217]{index=217}; CPC guidance (in Bulgarian)
Notes_for_Product: Treat all consumer calls as requiring explicit consent. No official DNC to check, but maintain internal opt-out list diligently. Be cautious with any unsolicited calls.
